summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
Specifies the seeking capabilities of a media stream.

member.name: AM_SEEKING_SEEKING_CAPABILITIES.AM_SEEKING_CanSeekAbsolute
member.summary: The stream can seek to an absolute position.

member.name: AM_SEEKING_SEEKING_CAPABILITIES.AM_SEEKING_CanGetCurrentPos
member.summary: The stream can report its current position. See Remarks.

member.name: AM_SEEKING_SEEKING_CAPABILITIES.AM_SEEKING_CanGetStopPos
member.summary: The stream can report its stop position.

member.name: AM_SEEKING_SEEKING_CAPABILITIES.AM_SEEKING_CanGetDuration
member.summary: The stream can report its duration.

member.name: AM_SEEKING_SEEKING_CAPABILITIES.AM_SEEKING_CanDoSegments
member.summary: The stream can do seamless looping (see ).
